editorialSummary.text: High-altitude, ancient Hindu temple featuring meditation, quiet reflection & panoramic views.

text.text: I couldn't found better rating so I gave it 5 star rating very humble. This quiet place is in Almora. It is place where Swami Vivekananda meditated. It is very peaceful . One can have very nice sunrise and sunset view from here.

text.text: There's a saying about this place that it's believed to be located on the Earth's Van Allen Belt( a huge lectromagnetic field ). The place surely has some extremely strong and positive aura. You can have the best view of both sunrise and the sunset here. People come for meditation and yoga, and even after spending hours in silence, you won't get even a bit bored here !

text.text: This temple is famously known as the only three places on this planet under the impact of highly charged geomagnetic fields that come within the Van Allen Belts discovered by NASA. Nestled on a hilltop stands the devi and shiva temple. One can view the entire town from the temple, itâ€™s best to take a seat on the rocks and enjoy the peace and feel the power of the magnificent energy. There is plenty of space to meditate. There are many other tales of swami Vivekanand & Devi maa as well. The temple is said to be over 2000 yrs old.

text.text: Here he is worshipped as God of justice, and believed that he rides the area on his white horse. People put write there issueâ€™s on paper and hung here, once there wish is fulfilled then people hung bells here. When u visit this please u see so many bells here.

text.text:
We were very blessed to visit this temple of Golu Ji Maharaja. There are many temples of Golu Devta; however, this one is the main temple, where a lot of devotees come every day throughout the year. Golu Devata is known for giving fair judgement in any conflict, dispute, or court case (as people believe). When you visit there, you can write down your personal issue or conflict on paper and tie it there with a bell. ðŸ””.
Beware of the monkeys there; while entering the temple or standing in queue, they snatch the prasadam or things. One should visit this place while in Almora.

text.text:
**Almora, Uttarakhand: A Himalayan Gem of Cultural Richness and Scenic Beauty**

Nestled in the Kumaon region of Uttarakhand, Almora stands as a testament to the harmonious blend of cultural heritage and breathtaking landscapes. Here's an in-depth review to guide you through the allure of this Himalayan town.

**Cultural Heritage:**
Almora, with its rich history dating back to the Chand dynasty, is a cultural treasure trove. The town is adorned with ancient temples, including the revered Nanda Devi Temple and Kasar Devi Temple. The intricately carved architecture and spiritual ambiance make these sites not only religiously significant but also fascinating for history enthusiasts.

**Scenic Beauty and Panoramic Views:**
Perched at an altitude of approximately 1,651 meters (5,417 feet) above sea level, Almora offers panoramic views of the surrounding Himalayan peaks. The town is situated atop a ridge, providing breathtaking vistas of snow-capped mountains, including Trishul and Nanda Devi. The Mall Road and Zero Point are popular vantage points offering spectacular views of the landscape.

**Best Time to Visit:**
The ideal time to visit Almora is during the spring and summer months, from March to June, when the weather is pleasant, and the flora is in full bloom. This period allows for comfortable exploration of the town and its surroundings. Monsoons (July to September) bring lush greenery but also occasional rainfall, while winter (December to February) offers a serene experience with chilly temperatures.

**Local Markets and Cuisine:**
Almora's local markets, such as Lala Bazaar and Mall Road, offer a delightful shopping experience with traditional Kumaoni handicrafts and unique local products. The town's cuisine, featuring local dishes like Bhaang ki Khatai and Singal, provides a gastronomic journey into the flavors of Kumaon.

**Cultural Festivals:**
Almora hosts various cultural festivals that showcase the vibrant traditions of the region. The Nanda Devi Mela is a significant event, celebrated with much fervor, drawing both locals and tourists to participate in the cultural extravaganza.

**Accommodation Options:**
Almora provides a range of accommodation options, from heritage hotels to budget-friendly guesthouses. Many establishments offer panoramic views of the mountains, providing a comfortable and immersive stay in the lap of the Himalayas.

In conclusion, Almora, with its cultural richness, scenic beauty, and Himalayan charm, offers a captivating retreat for travelers seeking a perfect blend of history and nature. Whether you're a culture enthusiast, nature lover, or someone in search of tranquility, Almora unfolds its charms in every corner, promising a memorable journey into the heart of the Kumaon Himalayas.

editorialSummary.text: Hindu temple to the Sun God built in the 9th century, comprising many carved stone structures.

text.text:
There are only 2 sun temples in Bharat, and Karatmal is one of them,
Few miles away from almora district this place has its own magnificent history and aura.

The temple itself, steeped in history, exudes an aura of ancient grandeur. Though not imposing in size, it captivates visitors with its timeless beauty, showcasing weathered stones and intricate details that tell stories of a bygone era. The view from this vantage point is nothing short of breathtaking, offering a glimpse of the past and the natural beauty of the surroundings.

To make your visit even more comfortable, there are drinking water taps available to quench your thirst after your exploration. If you find yourself in Uttarakhand, this unique destination is a must-visit, granting you the privilege of witnessing the one and only second sun temple in all of India.

text.text: Over eight centuries old, this intricately carved temple in Almora is set amid the jaw-dropping vistas and deodar forests of the Kumaon hills. This ancient structure dedicated to the sun god is one of the foremost temples of its kind. Despite its age, it continues to be the spiritual centre of this village and an important site of worship that brings in devotees from across the country especially during the annual Chhath Puja celebrations.

text.text:
It's a hidden gem amidst the jungle and valley of kasar devi.

It's about 8 kms from papersailley or the kasar devi road. Then you'll have to park vehicle road side.

It's a serene hike of about 2 kms. Not recommended for senior citizens. The route to reach the waterfall is a bit tricky.

But once you reach, it's absolutely mesmerising and the solace will give you relief.

Must visit. Kindly don't litter. Cheeeeeers ðŸº

text.text:
Balta waterfall is hidden by pine and deodar trees in the middle of a lush green dense forest. As you drive to the spot from where you must go on foot, be careful as the road is bad. While it is a steep hike from the road, it is worth a visit. You walk through a scenic jungle trail,
surrounded by mountains. Carry your own water, wear caps, and plenty of sunscreen. Locals warn you of leopard sightings even during the day at the waterfall, so it is advisable to go in a group. Both the path and the place are deserted. When you reach, the view is simply amazing! In the Monsoons, its gorgeous! Be careful with selfies though, people have slipped, and the water is freezing. Once done, do take all your garbage as you leave. Let us keep Balta waterfall pure and pristine.

originalText.text:

surrounded by mountains. Carry your own water, wear caps, and plenty of sunscreen. Locals warn you of leopard sightings even during the day at the waterfall, so it is advisable to go in a group. Both the path and the place are deserted. When you reach, the view is simply amazing! In the Monsoons, its gorgeous! Be careful with selfies though, people have slipped, and the water is freezing. Once done, do take all your garbage as you leave. Let us keep Balta waterfall pure and pristine.

text.text:
To reach Balta waterfall, you can drive to the village of Balta and then hike for about 1.5 kilometers. The hike is relatively easy, and it takes you through a scenic forest trail. Once you reach the waterfall, you will be rewarded with stunning views of the cascading water and the surrounding mountains.

Balta waterfall is a great place to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature. If you are looking for a peaceful and scenic spot to spend a day, then Balta waterfall is the perfect place for you.

To reach Balta waterfall, you can drive to the village of Balta and then hike for about 1.5 kilometers. The hike is relatively easy, and it takes you through a scenic forest trail. Once you reach the waterfall, you will be rewarded with stunning views of the cascading water and the surrounding mountains.

Balta waterfall is a great place to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature. If you are looking for a peaceful and scenic spot to spend a day, then Balta waterfall is the perfect place for you.

text.text:

Almora Zoo (Mrag Vihar) is situtated about 6 Km from Almora at Almora Barechhina Road, This zoo is  in hill area & its area is medium size. it has an animals like Leopard, Bear, Monkey, Deer, barasingha  ( Swamp Deer) and Rabbits. The white Deer & white Monkey is a rare one.
